posts.name: Harry Sanabria
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.43 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group .

Release notes:

  • The “Files” filter in the media gallery can help you quickly find PDFs and other attachments, like the TXT that really could have been a text.
  • We switched the emoji reaction picker in the Stories tab to work with the dark theme, but the right reaction can still provide enlightenment.
  • VoiceOver accessibility improvements, including a label for the call ring button and new functionality to indicate when a message includes a quoted reply.
  • We also updated the design of the QR codes throughout the app. They’ve always looked good in front of a camera, but they’re practically ready for a photo shoot now.

Let us know about any issues you experience! Thank you for being a beta tester!

In addition, this beta release continues a new feature we’re ready to test: linked device history syncing! In short, we’re using an end-to-end encrypted, device-independent backup format to optionally sync message history to newly-linked devices. This is a feature we’re super excited to release and we know many of you have been waiting for. We released a test run of this feature for Android → Desktop linking before the holidays, and we’re now ready to open it up for iOS as well. (Please check out that forum post for more technical details and an FAQ!)

Specifically, with this beta you’ll be able to sync message history:

  1. From a primary iPhone to a special Desktop build you can download from the earlier forum post .
  2. From a primary iPhone or Android to an iPad.

NOTE: Testing this involves a new linking of the device. The special Desktop build can be installed side-by-side with your existing Desktops, but unfortunately due to technical limitations we can’t do the same on iPad; so, testing this requires deleting existing Signal data from your iPad (either via Settings → Account → Delete All Data or by reinstalling) and re-linking. Re-linking will restore your message history and last 30 days of media, but as this is a new feature, bugs may exist; please use appropriate caution before deciding to test.

If you decide to test, please post logs (and any issues you encounter either during or after the sync) here or on the original forum post ! They’re helpful both if there was an error and if it succeeded (so we can get a sense of things like performance).

Thank you, as always, for being beta testers. We couldn’t build these features without your help.

link_counts.title: Help us test desktop history syncing!

posts.cooked: This is the same changelog as in the previous version.

Now I see there’s no Signal v7.43 beta for iOS tagged on GitHub yet:

10000335371080×2018 142 KB

Source: Tags · signalapp/Signal-iOS · GitHub

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: Whoops – good catch! Missed a step doing our release yesterday. It’s now pushed.

New Version: 7.43.0.559-beta

36 new commits since 7.42.0.550-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.43 [1]

  • Update to Xcode 16.2 [2]

  • Allow for restarting the provisioning flow (link'n'sync retry button) [3]

  • Add cancel button to link'n'sync [4]

  • Rework errors in primary side of link'n'sync to match latest product design [5]

  • Remove last remnants of OWSUserProfile caching [6]

  • Fix TESTABLE_BUILD-gated compile failure [7]

  • Missed TESTABLE_BUILD wrapper [8]

  • Skip archiving empty names in ContactAttachments [9]

  • Drop NORMAL-type quote-replies without any content [10]

  • Drop messages with cipher/content type mismatches [11]

  • Fix internal crash when opening call link calls [12]

  • [RegUI] Add placeholder text to backup key text view [13]

  • Don’t fetch localIdentifiers where it’s available [14]

  • Remove “Refresh Group” debug option [15]

  • Simplify hasInviteLinkPassword check [16]

  • Clean up some groups code formatting [17]

  • Fix bug refreshing groups after unblocking [18]

  • Require NSCopying when calling shallowCopy [19]

  • Stop reading deprecated serverEpochTime field [20]

  • Clear cached Backup auth credentials on subscription redemption [21]

  • Update libPhoneNumber metadata to 8.13.52 [22]

  • Remove unused string [23]

  • Fix incorrect limit on internal debug info [24]

  • Only redeem active subscriptions if no entitlement found [25]

  • Sort list of admins in admin-only groups [26]

  • Tidy Link'n'Sync logs [27]

  • Update primary Link'n'Sync progress view style [28]

  • Make TSAttachment migration skippable by user once we make it launch-blocking (but still incremental) [29]

  • Validate all timestamps we export in backups [30]

  • Fix some warnings when building for prod [31]

  • Update translation & unit test that uses it [32]

  • Link'n'Sync indeterminate primary spinner [33]

  • Update release notes [34]

  • Update translations [35]

  • Fix format specifier [36]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-iOS 7.42.0.550-beta…7.43.0.559-beta

New Version: 7.43.0.567-beta

4 new commits since 7.43.0.559-beta:

  • Include TSAttachments folder in device transfer [1]

  • Don't count TSAttachment migration batch as failure if we never even try it [2]

  • Remote config tsattachment migration delay [3]

  • Try the TSAttachment migration again after a week even if failed [4]

Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.41 release

Alright I’ve got a speculative fix for you; not sure if it will completely fix it but it should help. I’m not sure if it will go out in 7.41 but if it doesn’t it will definitely be in 7.42. Thanks for reporting!

Fixed since 7.42. Thanks!

Signal includes stickers in the left side of the emojis although it’s disabled in my iPhones settings. I can’t send them, but they appear in the list. Doesn’t happen in iMessage or WhatsApp
https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.43.0/14df2c12574591cff122e8c9453d8fa28316b428ed65d17f8b38c94128003f4a.zip

Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.44 release.

links.title: Help us test desktop history syncing!
